## Setting up the environment

### Installing required packages

```{r}
pacman::p_load(tidyverse, ggplot2, ggdist, ggthemes, colorspace, ggridges)
```

### Importing the Exam_data.csv
```{r}
exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")
```
## Visualising Distribution
```{r}

median_eng <- median(exam_data$ENGLISH)
mean_eng <- mean(exam_data$ENGLISH)
std_eng <- sd(exam_data$ENGLISH)

ggplot(exam_data,
       aes(x = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_density(
    color = "#1696d2",
    adjust = .65,
    alpha = .6
  )+
  stat_function(
    fun = dnorm,
    args = list(mean = mean_eng,
                sd = std_eng),
    col = "grey30",
    size = .8) +
  geom_vline(
    aes(xintercept = mean_eng),
    
  )
```
